text: The double-lined fusilier (Pterocaesio digramma) is a fusilier of the genus Pterocaesio. Also known as the banana fishWillcox, D. Craig and Makoto Suzuki, M.D. (2004). The Okinawa Diet Plan: Get Leaner, Live Longer, and Never Feel Hungry, p. 152 ., it is the prefectural fishhttps://www.pref.okinawa.jp/site/chijiko/kohokoryu/foreign/english/introduction/overview.html of Okinawa, Japan, where it is known as in Okinawan and in Japanese. Double- lined fusiliers are widespread in the Western Pacific, ranging from Indonesia to Western Australia, New Caledonia and northwards to Japan.https://www.fishbase.se/summary/933 They are found in coastal areas, primarily around coral reefs. ==Culinary uses== Fillets of Okinawan-style deep-fried gurukun Gurukun are widely eaten in Okinawan cuisine, mostly commonly served deep-fried as kara-age. ==Notes== ==References== * Carpenter K.E. (1988) FAO Species Catalogue: Vol 8: Fusilier fishes of the world Unipub. . Category:Caesionidae Category:Fish described in 1865
title: Double-lined fusilier
